channel.title: Comments on: MAMP Start Page Error

item.title: By: louis
item.dc:creator: louis
item.description: I am using MAMP PRO and have Document Root setup on Users/me/Sites folder. My localhost works but none of the Drupal 7 Multi-sites within the localhost Drupal sites folders. I receive 403 permissions error. I have permissions on the sites folder set to 666 and the settings.php file, so it looks like no issue there. I have also tried to set httpd.conf to use the Options Indexes MultiViews settings on all the options stated. Still 403 Forbidden error. I have no .htaccess in the Sites main folder but have tried to remove or rename the .htaccess file from the localhost folder. Still 403 Forbidden error. It's been 2 months now since I purchased MAMP PRO and have yet to solve this 403 Forbidden error and would appreciate receiving any help that is offered. At wits end!
item.content:encoded:
I am using MAMP PRO and have Document Root setup on Users/me/Sites folder. My localhost works but none of the Drupal 7 Multi-sites within the localhost Drupal sites folders. I receive 403 permissions error.
I have permissions on the sites folder set to 666 and the settings.php file, so it looks like no issue there.
I have also tried to set httpd.conf to use the Options Indexes MultiViews settings on all the options stated. Still 403 Forbidden error.
I have no .htaccess in the Sites main folder but have tried to remove or rename the .htaccess file from the localhost folder. Still 403 Forbidden error.
It’s been 2 months now since I purchased MAMP PRO and have yet to solve this 403 Forbidden error and would appreciate receiving any help that is offered.
At wits end!

item.title: By: Andrei
item.dc:creator: Andrei
item.description:
Well nice to see it worked for all of you. I'm still seeing the 403 Forbidden. "Changing AllowOverride All to AllowOverride None" - DONE, not working. "Deleting the .htaccess file" - Can't find one. I've looked everywhere. Nothing!
I'm stuck!
PS: The folder where I have my site (wordpress) it's working great. PhpMyAdmin is working great. But for the folder with an index.html i get 403 Forbidden!!!
item.content:encoded:
Well nice to see it worked for all of you. I’m still seeing the 403 Forbidden.
“Changing AllowOverride All to AllowOverride None” – DONE, not working.
“Deleting the .htaccess file” – Can’t find one. I’ve looked everywhere. Nothing!

I’m stuck!

PS: The folder where I have my site (wordpress) it’s working great. PhpMyAdmin is working great. But for the folder with an index.html i get 403 Forbidden!!!

item.title: By: Jon Hibbitt
item.dc:creator: Jon Hibbitt
item.description: Thanks for this - very nasty bug, luckily found this post in 20 minutes and was able to return to work.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for this – very nasty bug, luckily found this post in 20 minutes and was able to return to work.

item.title: By: Kaiko
item.dc:creator: Kaiko
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/07/08/mamp-start-page-error/#comment-2849">Joseph Scott</a>.
I had same problem here. Wordpress put htaccess file with modrewrite params in HD root during installation. Very odd, but true. After deleting it everything works fine. It's only WP installation related problem.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

I had same problem here. WordPress put htaccess file with modrewrite params in HD root during installation. Very odd, but true. After deleting it everything works fine. It’s only WP installation related problem.

item.title: By: Wallaby
item.dc:creator: Wallaby
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/07/08/mamp-start-page-error/#comment-2847">Eric</a>.
Deleting the .htaccess file as described worked! Thanks for the help.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Eric.

Deleting the .htaccess file as described worked! Thanks for the help.

item.title: By: Kevin Leary
item.dc:creator: Kevin Leary
item.description:
Thanks Joseph!
I had been trying the other fixes mentioned in the MAMP forums and they seemed to cause other issues. Changing <strong>AllowOverride All</strong> to <strong>AllowOverride None</strong> would fix the start page, but also destroy my WordPress rewrites.
This did the trick, thanks for sharing it!
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Joseph!

I had been trying the other fixes mentioned in the MAMP forums and they seemed to cause other issues. Changing AllowOverride All to AllowOverride None would fix the start page, but also destroy my WordPress rewrites.

This did the trick, thanks for sharing it!

item.title: By: Gabe Rosser
item.dc:creator: Gabe Rosser
item.description: Thank you so much! This was extremely helpful and worked perfectly the first time! Rare.
item.content:encoded: Thank you so much! This was extremely helpful and worked perfectly the first time! Rare.

item.title: By: Adam
item.dc:creator: Adam
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/07/08/mamp-start-page-error/#comment-2851">Will</a>.
Yes! That did it. Took me forever to find the solution...
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Will.

Yes! That did it. Took me forever to find the solution…

item.title: By: Carla
item.dc:creator: Carla
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/07/08/mamp-start-page-error/#comment-2866">Emi</a>.
After reading these suggestions and still not finding the .htaccess file, I followed your fix and it worked. Yea! It did prompt me that I was replacing an existing file on my HD.
So... from another 'really really dummy' out there... thank you for sending in this suggestion!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Emi.

After reading these suggestions and still not finding the .htaccess file, I followed your fix and it worked. Yea! It did prompt me that I was replacing an existing file on my HD.

So… from another ‘really really dummy’ out there… thank you for sending in this suggestion!
